messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

Sure—could you tell me a bit more about the message you’re looking for?  
Helpful details include things like:

• Who sent it (name, phone number, ID)?  
• Who received it?  
• Any part of the text you remember?  
• Roughly when it was sent (date or time range)?

The more of those details you can provide, the easier it will be to locate the message.

I’m afraid I need at least one hint—anything at all—to locate a specific message.  
Even something very rough can help, for example:

• About when it was sent (e.g., “early May,” “yesterday afternoon,” “sometime in 2022”)  
• A phrase or even a single word that might appear in the text  
• Who you think might have sent or received it (a name, phone number, or ID)  
• Whether it included an attachment or was part of a particular group chat

If literally none of that is available, I won’t be able to narrow the search: the system would have to retrieve every message ever sent, which isn’t practical. Could you think of any small clue—timeframe, sender, recipient, or keyword—to go on?
Just find the most recent one.

messages.name: search_messages
